techmeme.title: BSA, representing OpenAI, Microsoft, and others, urges Trump to review rules that are "unnecessarily impeding AI adoption" but to keep some of Biden's moves (Morgan Chalfant/Semafor)
OpenAI says the ChatGPT desktop app for MacOS can now read code in some developer-focused apps, including VS Code, Xcode, TextEdit, and Terminal (Maxwell Zeff/TechCrunch)
Sources: the FTC plans to probe allegations that Microsoft is abusing its market power in productivity software to prevent customers from leaving Azure (Financial Times)
François Chollet, the AI pioneer who created Keras, says he is leaving Google after nearly 10 years to start a new company, but doesn't reveal many details (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
Google plans to stop showing political ads to users in the EU in 2025 due to uncertainties around new transparency rules coming into effect in October 2025 (Jess Weatherbed/The Verge)
